skill.name: art-style-creator
skill.description: Create and define visual art styles for projects. Use when user wants to establish an art direction, create a style guide, define visual language, document aesthetic choices, or create consistent artwork guidelines for games, illustrations, animations, or other visual media.
skill.summary: Create and define visual art styles for projects. Use when user wants to establish an art direction,...
skill.author: CesarAugustusGroB

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing art education content. No executable code, network calls, or file system access. Static findings are false positives from markdown formatting and ASCII diagrams being misidentified as code patterns.

content.value_statement: Defining a consistent visual style is essential for project cohesion, yet many creators struggle to articulate their aesthetic vision. This skill provides a structured 10-step framework to create detailed art style guides covering color theory, line work, shapes, composition, lighting, and technical specifications.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through 10-step art style creation workflow
Generates comprehensive style documentation with templates
Provides color theory, composition, and lighting reference materials
Includes technical specifications for different output media
Offers genre-specific style presets (Anime, Cartoon, Realistic, etc.)
Creates reusable style guides for collaborative teams
limitations: Does not generate actual artwork or images
Requires user input for project-specific decisions
Style guides need manual implementation by artists
No integration with design software or graphics tools

use_cases.title: Define game visual identity
use_cases.description: Create art style guides ensuring consistent visuals across characters, environments, and UI elements.

use_cases.title: Develop artistic style
use_cases.description: Systematically explore and document visual preferences for a cohesive personal art style.

use_cases.title: Build team style guidelines
use_cases.description: Create detailed style bibles that multiple artists can follow for visual consistency.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Style Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an art style for my fantasy illustration project. I want something whimsical but not childish with a painterly feel.

prompt_templates.title: Game Art Direction
prompt_templates.prompt: I need an art style guide for a cozy farming simulation game. Target audience is casual players who enjoy games like Stardew Valley.

prompt_templates.title: Brand Visual Identity
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive art style for my eco-friendly brand that needs illustrations for web, print, and social media.

prompt_templates.title: Animation Style Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop a detailed animation art style for a sci-fi comedy series. It should be expressive but production-friendly for a small team.

output_examples.input: Create an art style for a dark fantasy game with gothic influences
output: Color Palette: Deep purples (#2D1B69) and burgundies (#800020) as dominant, bone white (#F5F1E6) accents, gold (#FFD700) highlights
Line Work: Thick, variable weight outlines (3-5px) with sketchy quality for organic feel
Shapes: Triangular/diamond shapes for architecture, elongated character forms, sharp silhouettes
Lighting: Low-key dramatic lighting with strong chiaroscuro, candle warmth, deep shadows
Texture: High detail with weathered stone, fabric textures, subtle grain overlay

output_examples.input: Create a style for a cute mobile puzzle game
output: Color Palette: Pastel pink (#FFB7B2), mint green (#B5EAD7), soft yellow (#FFFFD1) with warm white background
Line Work: No outlines or very thin (1px) soft lines in matching pastel tones
Shapes: Rounded circles and ovals exclusively, no sharp edges anywhere
Lighting: Flat, even lighting with subtle cel-shading for depth
Texture: Minimal detail, smooth surfaces, no weathering or aging

best_practices: Reference existing styles as starting points but modify to create uniqueness
Document specific measurements and technical details for team consistency
Create do's and don'ts sections with visual examples for clarity
Test style guide with multiple artists to ensure interpretability
anti_patterns: Copying popular styles exactly without adaptation or unique elements
Creating overly complex style guides that are difficult to follow
Ignoring technical constraints of target platform or medium
Skipping the mood and emotional tone definition phase

faq.question: Can this skill generate actual artwork?
faq.answer: No, this skill creates written style guides and documentation only. It defines visual direction but produces no artwork.

faq.question: Is this suitable for 3D projects?
faq.answer: The principles apply to both 2D and 3D, but templates are optimized for 2D visual styles. 3D projects may need additional specs.

faq.question: How detailed should my project description be?
faq.answer: Start with basic project type, target audience, and 3-5 descriptive words. The skill guides you through specific details.

faq.question: Can I use this for existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes, analyze existing work to identify patterns, then document them using templates to create formal style guides.

faq.question: What if I am unsure about my visual preferences?
faq.answer: The skill includes genre presets and reference materials. Start with these foundations and modify based on what resonates.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring an art director?
faq.answer: This skill creates documentation an art director would produce, but artistic skill is still needed to implement the style.
